<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of BASE64Encode:
```c
static ssize_t
BASE64Encode (const void *in, size_t len, char **output)
{
#define FILLCHAR '='
  const char *cvt = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"
                    "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
                    "0123456789+/";
  const char *data = in;
  char *opt;
  ssize_t ret;
  size_t i;
  char c;
  ret = 0;

  opt = malloc (2 + (len * 4 / 3) + 8);
  if (NULL == opt)
  {
    return -1;
  }
  for (i = 0; i < len; ++i)
  {
    c = (data[i] >> 2) & 0x3F;
    opt[ret++] = cvt[(int) c];
    c = (data[i] << 4) & 0x3F;
    if (++i < len)
    {
      c = (char) (c | ((data[i] >> 4) & 0x0F));
    }
    opt[ret++] = cvt[(int) c];
    if (i < len)
    {
      c = (char) (c | ((data[i] << 2) & 0x3F));
      if (++i < len)
      {
        c = (char) (c | ((data[i] >> 6) & 0x03));
      }
      opt[ret++] = cvt[(int) c];
    }
    else
    {
      ++i;
      opt[ret++] = FILLCHAR;
    }
    if (i < len)
    {
      c = data[i] & 0x3F;
      opt[ret++] = cvt[(int) c];
    }
    else
    {
      opt[ret++] = FILLCHAR;
    }
  }
  *output = opt;
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
  opt = malloc (2 + (len * 4 / 3) + 8);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated. opt is declared as char * and is assigned the result of malloc to provide a mutable output buffer that the function writes into. Rule 8.13 advises using const-qualified pointees when possible, but here the memory must be modifiable (the code stores encoded bytes into opt), so using a non-const char * is appropriate. Thus this malloc assignment does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13.
